questions.question: Why should you avoid using your high-beam headlights when driving in fog?
choices: Fog will reflect high beams back into your eyes
You cannot see approaching vehicles in time and might blind them
Approaching vehicles might not see you

questions.question: When something obstructs your view, the law prohibits passing another vehicle:
choices: Only within city limits
When there are two or more lanes
Within 100 feet of a tunnel

questions.question: When should you stop on an interstate?
choices: When signaled to stop by a police officer
When your cell phone rings
When you feel tired

questions.question: When entering a freeway:
choices: Drive faster than the freeway traffic to find a gap
Always turn your head to look quickly to the side before changing lanes (merging)
Merge onto the freeway as quickly as possible, vehicles on the freeway must always yield the right-of-way

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a flashing red light, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution
Slow down and stop, unless the way is clear
Stop completely, only proceed when safe and after observing right-of-way rules

questions.question: Most accidents involving a car and a motorcycle are the result of:
choices: The car driving too slowly
The car passing the motorcycle in the same lane
The car turning in front of the motorcycle.

questions.question: This warning sign means:
choices: Vehicles on this road travels in both directions
The one-way road widens into two lanes ahead
There is a divided highway ahead

questions.question: What color is the flag a flagger in a construction zone would use to direct traffic?
choices: Red
Yellow
Blue

questions.question: Always allow extra room in front of your vehicle when following:
choices: A large truck
A police car
A passenger car

questions.question: If you are convicted of a first violation for knowingly purchasing for or providing spirituous liquor to a minor, your driving privilege will:
choices: Be suspended up to 30 days
Be revoked
Not be affected

questions.question: When you approach a roundabout, you should:
choices: Keep your speed and enter a gap in traffic
Yield to pedestrians crossing the roadway
Activate turn signals when you enter the roundabout

questions.question: You should use extra caution when approaching a pedestrian using a white cane because:
choices: He or she is visually impaired
He or she has a walking problem
He or she has impaired hearing

questions.question: What should you check before you start driving?
choices: That your rear-view and side mirrors are properly adjusted
That your seat is high enough for you to clearly see the road
Both A. and B.

questions.question: Which lane should your vehicle be in after turning right into a two-lane, one-way street?
choices: Lane A, closest to the left curb
Lane B, closest to the right-hand curb
Either lane, it doesn't matter

questions.question: If an advisory speed sign isn't posted before a curve:
choices: It is always safe to keep the current speed
Slow down when you have entered the curve.
You must judge how sharp the curve is and change your speed accordingly

questions.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop at railroad crossings:
choices: A truck with hazardous load
A passenger car with young children
A motorcycle

questions.question: What is a no-zone in terms of driving?
choices: A no parking area
An area designated for pedestrians
Blind spots around large vehicles

questions.question: If you are involved in a collision, you must show your driver's license to:
choices: Any person involved in the collision
Security guards
All witnesses who ask for it

questions.question: This red and white sign means:
choices: The road is closed to traffic in your direction
Do not enter unless it is safe to do so
You must stop ahead

questions.question: You have given consent to take a test for determining the alcoholic level in your blood:
choices: Whenever you drive a motor vehicle in the state
Only if you have been drinking alcohol
Only if you have been involved in an accident

questions.question: It is illegal to park if a crosswalk is within:
choices: 30 feet
20 feet
10 feet

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Go left or straight ahead only
Side/Cross Road
Lane reduction ahead

questions.question: A school bus stops to drop off passengers in the far right lane on a four-lane street. The street does not have a barrier between lanes. Which traffic must stop?
choices: Lanes going in the opposite direction of the bus
Lanes going in the same direction as the school bus
All lanes of traffic

questions.question: A center lane with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line on both sides:
choices: Is used for making both right and left turns
Is used for making left turns
Is used for emergencies

questions.question: Which road signs have a black or white background?
choices: For regulation signs
For stop or prohibition
For public recreation and scenic guidance

questions.question: What is the meaning of this sign?
choices: There is a traffic signal ahead
The traffic signal ahead will show a red light
The traffic signal ahead is broken

questions.question: If you are convicted of driving in any part of a gore area, it will result in the following points on your driving record:
choices: Two
Three
Four

questions.question: The three-to-six-second rule helps a driver know:
choices: How closely to follow another vehicle
How much time it takes to pass
When to turn on headlights

questions.question: This hand signal means:
choices: Left turn
Stopping or slowing down
Right turn

questions.question: A driver must wear his seat belt:
choices: Even if the vehicle is equipped with airbags
Unless driving in inclement weather.
Only when driving 12 mph or faster

questions.question: An applicant for a graduated license must have completed a driver education program or completed how many hours of supervised driving?
choices: At least 50 hours
At least 30 hours
At least 12 hours

questions.question: When approaching an intersection where the traffic light changes from green to yellow, you should:
choices: Keep speed and continue through the intersection
Speed up and enter the intersection before the red light comes on
Stop, unless you are too close to the intersection to stop safely

questions.question: You approach a stopped school bus with flashing red lights on this roadway. You must:
choices: Stop when approaching a bus from either the front or the rear
Stop only when approaching a bus from the front
Stop only when approaching a bus from the rear

questions.question: You may change lanes when it is safe, and the line dividing the two lanes is:
choices: A broken white line
A double solid white line
Neither A. nor B.

questions.question: What do these signs mean?
choices: The speed shown is not in effect during the hours indicated
You must stop during the hours indicated
You may not drive faster than 15 mph during the hours indicated

questions.question: Using an unpaved shoulder to pass another vehicle on the right is:
choices: Allowed if the other vehicle is turning left
Never allowed
Allowed if the other vehicle is occupying more than one lane

questions.question: Passing another vehicle is prohibited:
choices: Within 100 feet of a railroad crossing
On roads without center lines
On one-way streets

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
choices: Start of divided highway ahead
One-way traffic ahead
Highway tunnel ahead

questions.question: Emotions affect your driving. If overly worried, excited, afraid, or angry, it is a good idea to:
choices: Drive 5-10 mph slower than the speed limit
Take drugs to calm you down
Give yourself time to control these emotions before driving

questions.question: Your car must have a horn that others can hear from a distance of:
choices: A horn is not a required equipment
At least 200 feet
At least 100 feet

questions.question: When may you drive faster than the maximum speed limit?
choices: When driving in the right lane
You may never drive faster than a posted maximum speed limit
When passing slower vehicles on a freeway

questions.question: When you want to exit a freeway, you should:
choices: Plan ahead and give yourself plenty of time
Signal your intention of exiting approximately one or two seconds before exiting
Always keep your speed until you left the freeway

questions.question: When you see this sign, how many curves should you expect close ahead?
choices: Two
Just one
Three or more

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout while driving, you should:
choices: Immediately step hard on the brakes
Immediately steer off the road
Steer straight ahead until your speed is safe for driving off the pavement

questions.question: Drinking just one drink of alcohol:
choices: Helps you stay awake and alert
Makes you a more careful driver
Can affect your judgment and ability to drive

questions.question: To be able to react in emergencies and avoid collisions, you should keep a cushion of space:
choices: In front of your vehicle
Behind your vehicle
Both A. and B.

questions.question: At a fire hydrant, parking is not allowed:
choices: Within 20 feet
Within 15 feet
Within 30 feet

questions.question: Where should children ages 12 and younger be placed in vehicles equipped with airbags?
choices: In the front seat
In either front seat or back seat, it doesn't matter
In the back seat

questions.question: If a visible railroad signal tells you that a train is approaching a crossing:
choices: Proceed through the crossing before the train is within fifteen hundred (1,500) feet of the crossing
Stop within fifty (50) feet but not less than fifteen (15) feet from the nearest rail
Stop within fifteen (15) feet from the nearest rail

questions.question: When making a left turn, you should:
choices: Look in all directions before starting to turn
Keep close to the right pavement marking
Keep your wheels pointed to the left before starting to turn

questions.question: Bicyclists must always ride:
choices: In the right-hand lane
On the shoulder
In the same direction as the flow of traffic

questions.question: When are you allowed to drink alcohol while driving?
choices: When you are 21 years or older
When you drive outside city limits
In no situation

questions.question: If you are stopped by a police officer and cited for a traffic law violation, you should avoid the following:
choices: Accepting the ticket.
Making a note of all relevant facts
Arguing your case with the officer

questions.question: The minimum amount your insurance must cover for property damage is:
When entering or crossing a road from a driveway:
choices: You can pass a sidewalk without stopping
You must yield the right-of-way to all approaching vehicles, but not to pedestrians
You must yield the right-of-way to all vehicles and pedestrians

questions.question: Road signs with the orange background are used:
choices: In no passing zones
In school zones
In work zones

questions.question: How do you check your blind spots while driving?
choices: By adjusting rear-view mirrors
By turning your head and looking over your shoulder
By adjusting side mirrors

questions.question: When should you drive with your parking lights turned on?
choices: When driving in fog
When it rains hard
Neither A. nor B.

questions.question: Night driving is more dangerous than daytime driving because:
choices: Drivers tend to be more alert at night
It is harder to see at night
There is less traffic at night

questions.question: What is helpful advice to fight off highway hypnosis and avoid getting tired on a long trip?
choices: Take regular rest stops
Turn off radio
Try to think about something else than driving

questions.question: On cold, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to hide spots of ice?
choices: Roadways on bridges and overpasses
Roadways paved with asphalt
Roadways on hilltops

questions.question: To get an Arizona operator permit (Class D), you must be at least:
choices: 15 years and 6 months of age
16 years of age
18 years of age

questions.question: The three-sided pennant shape is used for which road signs?
choices: Yield signs
Signs marking no-passing zones
Stop signs

questions.question: When approaching an uncontrolled T-intersection from a street ending at the intersection, you should:
choices: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Yield to vehicles coming from any direction
Both A. and B.

questions.question: What is true about using high-beam headlights?
choices: Use high beams whenever you are driving in residential areas
High beams are only recommended when it is raining or snowing
High beams should NOT be used when driving in fog

questions.question: Pavement markings with a white diamond mean:
choices: HOV lane
Railroad crossing ahead
Emergency lane

questions.question: Which pavement marking is on the right-hand side of a roadway?
choices: Solid white line
Broken white line
Solid yellow line

questions.question: You can park your car:
choices: 30 feet from a railroad crossing
On an unmarked crosswalk
On a hill

questions.question: The following are true about large trucks except:
choices: They need less room to maneuver
They have bigger blind spots than most cars
They have longer stopping distances than most cars

questions.question: When you approach a traffic signal with a steady red light:
choices: You must always stop completely
After stopping, you may turn right, unless prohibited by signs
Both A. and B.

questions.question: After a minor accident, the most important thing you can do to reduce the chances of secondary crashes is:
choices: Turn on your high beam headlights
Stand in the roadway and wave your arms
Move your vehicle off the roadway

questions.question: How can you warn drivers behind you if you see an accident ahead?
choices: By slowing down and stopping
By driving in the middle of two lanes
By turning on your emergency flashers

questions.question: Just when it starts to rain it may be a good idea to:
choices: Decrease the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead
Drive closer to the center of the road
Wait a short time before using your wipers

questions.question: A rule of thumb is to leave a three-second gap between your vehicle and the one in front when road conditions are:
choices: Dry
Wet
Icy

questions.question: You see this sign on a vehicle ahead. It means:
choices: The vehicle is moving slower than normal traffic
The vehicle is carrying a load that is potentially dangerous
The vehicle is wider than normal

questions.question: Driving at night is more hazardous than driving in the daytime:
choices: Only when there are other vehicles on the road
Unless you drive with headlights on high beam
Because it is harder to see at night

questions.question: Going around a lowered gate at a railroad crossing is:
choices: Permitted, if no red light is flashing
Permitted, if no gongs are sounding
Against the law

questions.question: When can you use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?
choices: When temporarily stopped at a red light
When making a call for emergency assistance
When checking text messages or e-mails

questions.question: If a school bus is stopped on a four-lane road with its stop-sign arm extended, you must:
choices: Stop if you are moving in the same direction of travel
Stop regardless of your direction of travel
Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: Your max stopping distance is directly related to:
choices: Your perception time
Your reaction time
Both A. and B.

questions.question: You approach this sign. What should you expect ahead?
choices: A sharp turn to the right
A detour
A winding road

questions.question: Which statement is true about alcohol and driving?
choices: Alcohol affects judgment and driving skills
If you can walk a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive
If you are below the legal BAC limit, your driving is not impaired

questions.question: What should you do if you approach a stopped police vehicle with activated emergency lights on a multi-lane roadway?
choices: Move over and proceed with due caution
Keep your speed and avoid stopping
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Cross Road
Cattle crossing ahead
Slow moving vehicles
